title: 105_hr1414
content: The Ukrainian American Veterans, Incorporated, organized under the laws of New York, is granted a Federal charter with specific powers outlined in its bylaws and articles of incorporation. The Ukrainian American Veterans, Incorporated, is granted a Federal charter with specific powers outlined in its articles of incorporation, including a commitment to preserve, protect, and defend the Constitution of the United States, commemorate military actions, honor veterans, raise awareness about their sacrifices, and collect records of patriotic service. The Ukrainian American Veterans, Incorporated is granted a Federal charter to preserve the Constitution, honor veterans, commemorate military actions, raise awareness about sacrifices, and collect records of patriotic service. Additionally, they aim to foster the association of veterans of Ukrainian descent who have served in the Armed Forces of the United States. SEC. 4. RESTRICTIONS. The corporation is restricted from using income or assets for the benefit of members, officers, or directors. However, reasonable compensation and reimbursement for expenses are allowed. Loans to any member, officer, director, or employee are prohibited. Political activity and attempts to influence legislation are also prohibited. The corporation cannot issue stock or pay dividends. The corporation is prohibited from issuing stock or paying dividends. It cannot claim approval from Congress or the Federal Government for its activities. It must maintain its status as a corporation organized under the laws of New York and function as an educational, patriotic, civic, and historical organization. The corporation is liable for the acts of its officers, directors, employees, and agents within their authority. Maintenance and inspection of books and records are required. SEC. 6. The corporation must maintain correct and complete books and records of account, including minutes of proceedings involving members, the board of directors, or any relevant committee. It must also keep a record of members' names and addresses at its principal office. Members have the right to inspect the books and records for any proper purpose. No provision in this section can go against applicable State law. SEC. 7. AUDIT OF FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS. The Act is amended to include Ukrainian American Veterans, Incorporated. SEC. 8. ANNUAL REPORT. The corporation must submit an annual report to Congress on its activities. SEC. 9. RESERVATION OF RIGHT TO AMEND OR REPEAL CHAPTER. Congress reserves the right to amend or repeal this Act. SEC. 10. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 10. DEFINITIONS. The term "corporation" refers to the Ukrainian American Veterans, Incorporated, and the term "State" includes various territories and possessions of the United States. SEC. 11. TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. The corporation must maintain its tax-exempt status as per the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. SEC. 12. TERMINATION. The charter granted will expire if the corporation fails to comply with the Act's provisions.
